text: Michael Ian Pamment (12 May 1945 – 16 July 2006) was an English professional footballer who played as a centre forward. ==Career== Born in Huddersfield, Pamment joined Bradford City from Kirkburton Youth Club in 1962.Frost, p. 403 He joined the first team in July 1964, and made 1 league appearance for the club.Frost, p. 387 He left the club in 1965, and later played for Emley, Mossley, Stalybridge Celtic, Bradford (Park Avenue) and Buxton. He joined Mossley from Emley in 1970, making 40 appearances and scoring 16 goals. Pamment represented England at youth level. ==Sources== * ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2006 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Huddersfield Category:English footballers Category:England youth international footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Bradford City A.F.C. players Category:Wakefield F.C. players Category:Mossley A.F.C. players Category:Stalybridge Celtic F.C. players Category:Bradford (Park Avenue) A.F.C. players Category:Buxton F.C. players Category:English Football League players
title: Mike Pamment
